handist.mpijunit

Annotation Type MpiConfig


  • @Documented
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Target(value=TYPE)
public @interface MpiConfig
    Annotation used to set some environment settings for test classes that use the MpiRunner. At a minimum, test classes have to specify how many processes are desired for the test. You can also specify a specific launcher if you need some specific setup or initialization that involves multiple hosts before launching the tests.
    Author:
    Patrick Finnerty

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element and Description
      int ranks
      Indicates how many ranks (parallel processes) are desired to run the test class.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      Class<?> launcher
      Indicates which launcher should be used.

    • Element Detail

      • ranks

        public abstract int ranks
        Indicates how many ranks (parallel processes) are desired to run the test class. There are no default value for this setting and it needs to be set by the user.
        Returns:
        number of MPI processes to be launched

      • launcher

        public abstract Class<?> launcher
        Indicates which launcher should be used. The launcher is the class whose main method is responsible for launching the tests in each MPI process. By default, class MpiTestLauncher is used.

        Using a different class than the default may be useful if you have some specific setup to do before launching the Junit tests runtime. One such specific launcher we provide in this library is the MpiApgasTestLauncher which sets up the APGAS runtime before launching the tests. Of course you can also use your own custom launcher.

        Returns:
        the class whose main will be launched by all the parallel processes
        Default:
        handist.mpijunit.MpiTestLauncher.class
